topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Administer Your Cloud Using the HCG Dashboard

section.p: The HCG Dashboard is a cloud management tool that allows you to define, deploy, and manage the Standard Region of your HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud.

section.title: Launch the HCG Dashboard
section.p: The HCG Dashboard is available when the lifecycle manager VM is deployed. The dashboard service runs on port 8000 and can be accessed using http://<CLM_IP>:8000/.

ol.li: Launch a browser and navigate to http://<CLM_IP>:8000/.

Log into the HCG Dashboard UI. By default use
username: cghelion
password: cghelion
If this is the first time you have logged in, you will be prompted to change the password before you can continue. Once password is updated, you will need to log in again with newly created password.

section.p: Click the Create New Cloud Definition link to open the Input for Cloud table to create a new cloud definition that you can use to deploy the Standard Region. The HCG Dashboard verifies much of the information as you enter it.
Specific instructions for using this table can be found in the installation instructions under Deploy the Standard Region Using the HCG Dashboard UI.

section.title: Manage your clouds
section.p: Click the List of Clouds link to open the List of Cloud Definitions table where you can see a list of cloud definitions and the current status of any cloud associated with the definition.

For the cloud you want to manage, click the Manage button to open the Manage Services table where you can restart services running on the Standard Region controllers. You can restart all services, all services on a controller, or specific services on one controller.
You can also open the Input for Cloud table to edit a cloud definition or open the Deploy Cloud table to deploy a cloud definition.
For information on managing your cloud, see Managing Your Cloud with the HCG Dashboard.

section.title: Deploying a cloud
section.p: Click the Deploy Cloud link to open the deploy table where you can deploy the Standard Region based on one of your cloud definitions.
For information on deploying a cloud, see Deploying a Cloud with the HCG Dashboard.
